Issue.creator: jyellick
Issue.summary: As a fabric developer, I need a way to stop chaincodes built and launched by the externalbuilder
Issue.description: This is currently ill defined, and we may decide that it is invalid. Still, with existing chaincodes, particularly the docker ones, it is possible to stop a chaincode. This is useful in integration style tests, and, would be nice to have for when a chaincode is no longer referenced in any channels, we could automatically stop it to conserve resources. For this latter bit, we have seen users who deploy many iterations of a chaincode in development, and resource exhaust their machines as all copies remain running.
